physical_appearance:This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and portrait in orientation. It features a group of women
 all dressed in uniform
 casually standing in a group. Some of them are facing towards the camera. Behind them
 there is a section of a plane seen. People are seen disembarking from the plane. There are no tears or folds seen in the photograph.

sgcool_label_text:This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life
 including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.

metadata.title_text: "Personal photograph album titled ""Sixteen Months in Singapore""" Sixteen Months in Singapore: Photograph of uniformed women by plane
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and portrait in orientation. It features a group of women, all dressed in uniform, casually standing in a group. Some of them are facing towards the camera. Behind them, there is a section of a plane seen. People are seen disembarking from the plane. There are no tears or folds seen in the photograph.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life, including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.
